entries.meaning: (Ireland) An extra product given to a customer at no additional charge; a lagniappe.
examples: Myles: "Indeed your Honour may safely say so : Iwas ploughing away  […]  when I bethought how I forgot to tell little Jem, when he'd be buying my pen'orth of snuff, to be sure to get it in two separate ha'porths, the way he'd have the two tillies. So what could Ido but run home, to  […]  go myself for the snuff, and be sure to get my tillies.

description: From WWII British Army usage Tilly (“name of a range of British Army vehicles”), from utility.

examples: After a fortnight's careful nursing my leg healed and I was packed off in a tilly (utility truck) with my kit-bag to join my comrades at Fairmilehead.

adjectives.description: tilly (comparative more tilly, superlative most tilly)
